Description: A collection of many short cylindrical and barrel beads: of pinkish limestone, and four of bone, now strung together.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, Grave 2221 These were found in an undisturbed child's burial
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: beads (1929,1015.238 & 1929,1015.240) shells (1929,1015.239). Brunton describes the pinkish limestone beads as being made of shell. Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 40; pl. XXII, 46; Grave register, pl. IX; Bead corpus, pl. XXXIX, 86F23.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (29)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006-present, Glasgow, Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum, LT Loan Ancient Egypt British Museum Partnership Gallery
